Job description


About the Role


The Infrastructure and Hosting Service Delivery team are responsible for the stability and maintenance of infrastructure and platform services. This role will focus on the Cloud Platform.


The role will be responsible for the continuous improvement of AGL's growing Cloud platform ensuring; cost optimisation, environment stability, service right sizing, and cloud governance.


The role will work with key 3rd party partners to ensure platform stability.


Key Responsibilities

  • Project reviews- review proposed solutions and costing models from business-driven projects
  • Project advisory- work with business projects to ensure Cloud best practices are being met
  • Project engineering - be available to deploy services, as required
  • Continuous improvement- Cost optimise the platform using techniques such as; right timing, right sizing, hybrid benefit licenses, reserved instances
    • As well as maintaining the above, identify new cost optimisation opportunities
    • Templated builds are maintained and up to security and operational standards
    • Creation and onboarding of new Cloud Operations processes and runbooks




About You


We are looking for someone who has the eagerness to learn new technology and a willingness to innovate and work in a fail fast environment

  • In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Azure
  • Cloud based certifications
  • Must have extensive experience in IT
  • Expertise in PowerShell scripting
  • An understanding of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS
  • Eagerness and willing to learn in a culture that fosters experimentation
  • Ability to work in Agile projects


What's in it for you?


You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.

Company Name Hender Consulting Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Job description

Latrobe Health Services

Established in 1951 and headquartered in Morwell in regional Victoria, Latrobe Health Services is a well established and respected member-focused, not-for-profit fund providing health cover to over 80,000 people nationally. It has an annual turnover exceeding $150m and staff numbers of around 80 in the private health insurance arm of the business and around 140 at the Maryvale Private Hospital which is a fully owned subsidiary of Latrobe Health Services. \xa0

\xa0

Reporting to the CEO as a key part of the tight-knit Executive Team, the CIO is a pivotal senior management role responsible for the development, implementation and advancement of the IT strategy and technology roadmaps, ensuring alignment of the technology environment to achieve Latrobe’s strategy and direction. Providing visionary leadership to a capable and diverse technology team focussed on delivering an effective, secure and reliable IT environment, the CIO will also lead key strategic projects and ensure collaborative relationships with internal stakeholders and technology partners.

\xa0

Applications are sought from highly accomplished IT leaders with relevant tertiary qualifications and proven experience leading comparable technology, applications, infrastructure and data architecture solutions. Financial services sector experience is desirable but not essential. Strong technology (specifically digital) awareness and strategic planning capabilities along with superior communication and values based leadership skills will also be important. A proven track record in executive level collaboration and influencing is sought.

\xa0

Most importantly, the successful candidate will demonstrate drive, energy, warmth, intellect, resilience and proven capability to define, represent and achieve the organisation’s technology goals.

\xa0

An attractive executive package will be negotiated to secure a dynamic and highly engaging ICT leader capable of making a significant contribution to Latrobe and its members.

\xa0

For a job and person specification, please visit henderconsulting.com.au and for further information on our client, please visit latrobehealth.com.au

\xa0About the Role
Life Without Barriers has been selected by the Victorian Government to operate a number of Supported Independent Living (SIL) and Short Term Accommodation and Assistance Programs (STAA) currently managed by the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS). To make the transfer of the services to Life Without Barriers as smooth as possible for the participants, staff and families involved, a number of positions are now available in this exciting project. These positions include a Senior People, Safety and Culture Advisor based in the Inner Eastern Suburbs of Melbourne. Due to the growth we are currently seeking an additional office which is close to being finalised, however, will be in the Inner Eastern suburbs.
\xa0
Key responsibilities

  • Review and analyse future employment relations obligations in accordance with the terms and conditions associated with the transferring workforce
  • Establish relevant policies, procedures, processes, reporting tools, training content and systems to support the operation and implementation of the terms and conditions associated with the transferring workforce
  • Support the HR Project Manager in the achievement of key project milestones
  • Provide advice, support and coaching to leaders on a range of complex and sensitive IR or HR issues.

Skills & Experience
  • Tertiary qualifications in Human Resources or Employment Relations

  • Demonstrated ability to use initiative and think laterally and strategically
  • Demonstrated ability to develop business partnerships with all levels

How to Apply

Job description

At Box we are changing the way companies work, share content, and collaborate. We have grown year over year and are adding dynamic and energetic salespeople to evangelise Box and uncover pivotal deals.

Our Outbound Business Representatives (OBRs) are a key part of a Regional Sales team consisting of a Sales Manager, Commercial, and/or Enterprise Sales Executives. You will support all levels of the sales organisation by finding new revenue opportunities that add to the total pipeline. You will make meaningful relationships with Senior Account Executives, Sales Engineers and Regional Directors along with potential future customers. You will have the opportunity to up sell and cross sell with key product offerings like Governance, KeySafe, Platform, and Zones.

What makes an OBR successful? We are a team of creative, tireless hunters looking for green-field opportunities within potential customers. We are effective communicators, quick thinking, resilient, and partners. And we like to have fun.

  • Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and Closed Business
  • Conduct high level conversations with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts
  • Work closely with Sales Management, Regional Directors and individual Sales Reps to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business
  • Generate new business opportunities to fuel the Box Commercial Sales and Enterprise Pipeline
  • Create, prioritise, and qualify strategic target account lists within a defined territory
  • Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails, coordinating strategic discovery meetings )
  • Evangelise Cloud Content Management using Box


Qualifications
  • Prospecting experience , exceeding quotas.
  • CRM experience is a must, SFDC a plus
  • SaaS experience a plus
  • Excellent written/verbal communication skills
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Obvious passion and people skills

  • Degree level education; bright and quick thinking.
  • A Box account (it's free!)

    The Senior Team Leader, Occupations Planning is responsible for facilitating the planning and coordination of all planned disruptions.

    \xa0

    You will be responsible for managing the Master Occupation Schedule. You will need to understand impacts to the whole public transport network, identify risks and potential mitigations and manage assurance to readiness.

    \xa0

    You will also be required to work collaboratively with a broad range of senior stakeholders, including transport operators, project agencies, government departments and a varied range of functional divisions. \xa0

    \xa0

    You must possess excellent project management skills and an ability to identify, articulate and mitigate variable level and volume of risk. You must be able to provide high level consideration and critical thinking to the customer, commercial, contractual and resource implications of the program.

    \xa0

    This role requires extremely high attention to detail and a focus on accurate, timely and concise reporting and briefing skills. The incumbent must be able to provide expert and authoritive advice with ability to present, reliably inform and influence executive and senior stakeholders across the transport industry.

    \xa0

    Functional responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):

    \xa0

    • Oversee the development and maintenance of an accurate master events schedule which clearly details the timing and methodology of all planned disruption events.

    • Provide high levels of subject matter expertise and detailed analysis to ensure effective decision making and the delivery of a customer focused, coordinated and balanced program of disruptions.

    • Operators and project agencies comply with the requirements defined within PTV’s customer and occupations assurance and coordination frameworks.

    • Able to manage complex delivery schedules and ensure delivery of a safe, integrated, efficient and reliable public transport network with an ‘single minded focus’ on minimising customer disruption.

    • Chair a broad range of occupation coordination forums and committees with wide range of sector stakeholders.

    • Develop and maintain effective working relationships with a broad range of stakeholders including, but not limited to, Local Governemnt and State Government representatives, events stakeholders, Accredited Transport Operators and Project Agencies.

    • Ensure all planned disruptions are facilitated with a priority on optimal customer outcomes and act as a customer advocate in all discussions regarding planned disruption.

    • Develop innovative strategies and initiatives to support improved productivity, efficiency and productivity within the context of planning and scheduling activities. \xa0

    • Effective management of staff in the Planned Occupations team to ensure their continued development as part of a high performance team and culture in a manner consistent with the PTV values. \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

      \xa0

    What you’ll need to succeed

    \xa0

    • Demonstrated understanding and extensive experience in the planning of public transport operations with a focus on service planning and customer service requirements.

    • Extensive knowledge of transport operations and the public transport environment throughout metropolitan and regional Victoria.

    • Possess high level project management and scheduling skills with a particular focus on planning and implementing event related public transport services.

    • Proven ability to collect, monitor, integrate, analyse and evaluate complex information.

    • Demonstrator ability to achieve financial, quality and time related targets for programs and be responsible for meeting services objectives, including financial, quality and time related targets for programs or major projects.

      \xa0

    What you’ll get in return

    \xa0

    In return, you will be joining one of Victoria’s most reputable government organisations who will support and develop your career within the organisation. PTV also offer long term opportunities and a company culture that is second to none. On offer is a very competitive remuneration package, modern state of the art offices and the opportunity to develop your career with one of the best government organisations within the industry.

    \xa0

    Qualifications

    Mandatory

    • Tertiary qualification in Public Policy, Transport, Planning or a related discipline or significant relevant experience.

      \xa0

      \xa0

    How to apply

    Please click the ‘Apply Now’ button below. Your application must include a cover letter and separate resume (MS Word compatible). For further information about the role, please refer to the attached position description and capability framework documents. If you have any questions specific to the role, please contact Angela Grice on Mobile:0437 636 859 or email angela.grice@ptv.vic.gov.au.

    \xa0

    Applications close 11:59 P.M. Sunday, 21st October 2018

    \xa0

    Emailed applications will not be accepted.

    \xa0

    Unsolicited recruitment agency applications will not be accepted.

    \xa0

    Public Transport Victoria is committed to fostering a work environment that is inclusive and supports diversity and flexibility. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

    \xa0

Company Name UniSuper Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

About Us

UniSuper is one of Australia’s largest superannuation funds, and is run solely for the benefit of its members. For more than 35 years, UniSuper has been managing super for people employed in the higher education and research sector. UniSuper currently invests around $70 billion on behalf of 400,000+ current and former higher education and research employees.

The Opportunity

Our Risk & Assurance team is moving to the next phase of building UniSuper’s risk management capability to drive better business decision making. As the Senior Manager, Regulatory Compliance you will work in close partnership with the Risk Advisory team as well as the Legal Advisory team in ensuring an appropriate regulatory assessment of compliance incidents.

You will be pivotal in managing engagement and relationships with our Regulators and monitoring regulatory change impacting UniSuper. You will also display and maintain an understanding of UniSuper’s strategy and business plan, prudential standards, financial services regulatory requirements as well as other relevant regulatory compliance obligations.

About You

Ideally you’ll bring your own mix of skills and experience to the team, but some of that will include:
  • Relevant qualifications and/or accreditations
  • 10+ years’ professional experience, with at least 7 years in relevant roles in the superannuation industry
  • Knowledge of the legislative and regulatory framework governing the superannuation, funds management, advice or financial services industry

You Also Have
  • An ability to connect the dots across the business value chain to understand regulatory compliance exposures
  • Experience in dealing with regulators
  • Polished written communication with an ability to provide thorough, timely and accurate reporting to all stakeholders
  • Business acumen and attention to detail
  • Ability to work with business to provide pragmatic and commercial options to achieve compliance
  • Strong interpersonal skills and an ability both to work independently and to provide responsive assistance to colleagues



What we offer
A challenging, collaborative and fun culture. You will have the freedom and flexibility to develop in your role whilst receiving the support to build your own career in an innovative risk environment.

We give you two days a year to volunteer your time as well as three extra days of annual leave between Christmas and New Year, when we close our office. We also offer gym discounts and have onsite massages to ensure your health and well-being.

In addition to 17% superannuation and support for salary sacrifice arrangements, you can access our Financial Advisers at a reduced rate to help you plan your financial future.

If this resonates and you think it's the right next move for you, please get in touch.

The role is being recruited by our internal Talent Team and should we require recruitment agency assistance, we will reach out to our preferred partners.

Manager Media Relations

Company Name Philip Morris International Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At PMI we value a culture that is built on professionalism, reputation and pride. You experiment, learn and succeed. Whether you work with us for one year or ten, you will learn the skills that open doors to any career you want. In 2016, our company was recognised by the Australian Government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an employer of choice for gender equality. This recognition was part of our commitment to being a great place to work that puts our employees at the centre of our business and develops world class talent.

Are you inquisitive and self-driven? Will you make a difference to our company and your colleagues around you? If you answered yes, then we want to hear from you.

BEND THE NORM

We offer you a fresh perspective. Here, you will never stop exploring and discovering. We take on-the-job learning to another level, giving you every opportunity to develop your career and reach your full potential. With innovative technologies, services, and processes, backed by a competitive salary package, you will work in a professional setting with clients and colleagues all over the world.

RISE TO THE CHALLENGE

As Manager Media Relations, you will be responsible for high-quality media relations and communication across multiple audiences and channels to raise awareness of our vision for a smoke-free world. This includes seeking news opportunities, delivering targeted media and communication strategies, and wider communication in support of achievement of the organisation’s vision and goals. We are also looking for someone who can

• Develop and drive strategies for establishing and maintaining relationships with key media, business organisations and other key stakeholders in order to successfully communicate targeted messages

• Develop effective messaging in conjunction with the Communications and Engagement Function as well as supporting materials for direct media engagement

• Prepare, brief and advise company spokespeople and ensure all relevant staff have received media training ready to face the media at a moment’s notice

• Manage and effective media monitoring and social media listening.

INNOVATION STARTS WITH TRYING

We’re looking for someone who has
• Demonstrated experience (at least 3 years) in media relations and content development, including a sound understanding of the Australian media landscape.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and the ability to identify news stories.

• Experience managing multiple, complex and time-sensitive projects.

• Sound understanding of Australia’s political, regulatory and social landscape.

• Strong network of media contacts and experience identifying and mitigating risks and issues.

SHARE OUR VISION

We’ve built the world’s most successful cigarette company, with the world’s most popular and iconic brands.
Now we’ve made a dramatic decision.
We will be far more than a leading cigarette company. We’re building PMI’s future on smoke-free products that are a much better choice than cigarette smoking.
Indeed, our vision – for all of us at PMI – is that these products will one day replace cigarettes.
Why are we doing this?
Because we should...

We understand the millions of men and women who smoke cigarettes. They are looking for less harmful, yet satisfying, alternatives to smoking. We will give them that choice.
We have a commitment to our employees and our shareholders. We will fulfill that commitment by pursuing this long-term vision for success.

Society expects us to act responsibly. And we are doing just that by designing a smoke-free future.
…and because we now can.

Success in the cigarette business gives us the resources to pursue our ambitious vision.
Thanks to the imagination and perseverance of thousands of people at PMI, we have developed breakthrough products that are smoke-free and enjoyable.
And, we are selling them today. Millions have already given up smoking and switched to our new products, and this is just the beginning.
We’re investing to make these products the Philip Morris icons of the future.
A future PMI that’s known for replacing cigarettes with a portfolio of revolutionary products.

In changing times you can always choose to do nothing. Instead, we’ve set a new course for the company. We’ve chosen to do something really big.

Candidates must legally be able to work in Australia.

Applications close 7 October 2018.

Unlimit Yourself @ PMI

  • Consumer Goods
  • Tobacco

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Marketing
  • Public Relations
  • Writing/Editing

Job description

Ceridian. Makes Work Life Better™

This is our promise. Not only for our customers, but our employees as well.

Ceridian is a cloud company powered by our people. As an innovative fast-growing global, human capital management (HCM) technology company, join us as we transform the world of work for millions of employees around the world. Our products help employees be paid on time, apply for promotions, grow their careers, and support their work/life fit. Our solutions and our people work together to help organizations control costs, save time, optimize their workforce, minimize risk, and grow their businesses. We are proud of our many recent accomplishments, which include setting a record in the TSX as the largest tech IPO in Canadian history, and having our leader recognized as a Top CEO by Glassdoor’s Employees’ Choice awards for the third time.

Ceridian has not only invested heavily in cloud software development but in its people as well. Our workplace experience provides employees with empowering programs for career growth and includes diversity/inclusion groups to support every person’s career journey. At Ceridian we not only work hard, but we play hard too. Each office has its own unique Fun at Work experience which includes events such as social hours, team building competitions, and other fun occasions for all employees to enjoy. We believe in giving back to the communities that we live in, by volunteering our time and contributing to our own charity foundation, Ceridian Cares. We also have a wide-range of flexible benefits to support our people’s work life blend and meet their needs.

We are looking for fun, intelligent, team oriented people who believe in our values: Customer Focus, Transparency, Diligence, Optimism, and Agility.

Find out why Ceridian employees declare Ceridian a Great Place to Work\xae in 2018, a Glassdoor Best Places to Work in 2018, and one of Canada’s Top 100 Employers for the 15th consecutive year!

Ceridian keeps on growing and growing, and we have a growth opportunity for you to join our Support team!

We are looking for a Support Leader/Customer Support Manager (CSM) to join our new team located in Melbourne!

What Ceridian Can Offer You
  • Collaborate with the brightest team in Human Capital Management with locations in USA, Canada, the UK and Mauritius.
  • Training: develop deep technical expertise and gain valuable business/industry related experience
  • Flat hierarchy: work, eat, and engage with company execs
  • Ceridian offers the best of both worlds - the excitement of working in a growing startup environment, combined with the opportunities of a large organization
  • Flexible vacation and comprehensive benefits plan
  • Employee driven career path; Top Talent, Career Talk, Career Pathing, Tuition Reimbursement, Mentorship, & Job Rotation are just some of the People programs we have to help you advance your career
  • Bring your whole self to work; casual dress code, a diverse workforce, and some of the greatest people around to make your work day better!

Job Description

As a Ceridian Support Leader, you join a Global Ceridian Support team made up of hundreds of colleagues in locations around the globe dedicated to providing a great Customer Experience with every interaction. You will assume a key leadership role in our Melbourne Team responsible for leading and building diverse, engaged, high performing teams that embrace and reflect Ceridian’s culture and values, and overseeing the smooth integration of our delivery model with high profile client stakeholders. From SaaS Support to full Managed Services, you will be a driver of compliance with payroll processing, remittance, reporting and applicable filing obligations on behalf of our customers and have full engagement lifecycle responsibility through to overseeing the ongoing delivery from a service perspective

Specific performance and personal competencies required for the position include:

  • Leadership and subject matter experience in HCM consulting, SaaS Support, and/or Managed Services with a strong concentration in Australian payroll
  • Managing a broad scope of day-to-day operations and proven experience in building high performing., and highly engaged teams
  • Experience in dealing with high volume payroll (circa 3,000) customer employees
  • Strong communication and people advocate and management skills
  • Comfortable working in a pre-sales and project capacity and exhibit exemplary presentation skills.
  • Experience in managing all stages of the HCM cycle: assessment, design, standards, variance analysis, implementation and delivery
  • Aptitude to learn our technology and processes to act as a consultant for client engagements
  • Comfortable in building strong relationships with clients to understand client perspectives on service and value being delivered whilst maintaining cost efficiency in payroll delivery
  • Ability to effectively work globally, engaging with partners and leaders in North America, the UK, and Mauritius on a regular basis.

    • Qualifications

  • Hands on experience in Australian payroll practices, regulations and taxes
  • Ability to comprehend and analyze intricate regulatory payroll tax information, including having a comprehensive understanding of stock options/RSU and LTIC payments for local and country transfers
  • Ability to participate in client discovery sessions with internal and external stakeholders
  • 10 years of strong people management, leadership, interpersonal, coaching, organizational, skills combined with the ability to lead large teams.
  • Analytical, problem solving and organizational skills applied in a constantly changing fast paced environment.
  • Australian Payroll Association Member with Payroll management qualification would be
    • considered an asset

  • Experience leading, managing or working with both offshore teams as well as third party vendors.
  • Process improvement or simplification experience.
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, related field or equivalent experience.

    • Responsibilities

  • You will have overall responsibility for managing the team’s timely resolution of tickets related to SaaS support
  • Primary Management contact resolution of complex issues where considerable judgement is required.
  • Manage, lead, mentor and develop a team of engaged, high performing, payroll and support professionals
  • Functionally identify, plan and execute procedural improvements in relation to payroll to enhance as well as promote effectiveness, efficiency, compliance and accuracy.
  • Maintain internal control standards, including timely implementation of internal and external audit points together with any issues raised by audits.
  • Review summaries of process control findings, present issues to management. Coordinate and supervise the development and implementation of action plans to address issues or findings.
  • Manage, support, or participate in large scale and/or cross functional domestic as well as global projects as it relates to payroll.
  • Review and update effective internal controls within the payroll function, ensuring that payroll errors are minimised and changes administered accurately and promptly.
  • Act as a member of the Payroll project team, assisting in software system implementation, to deliver the group-wide payroll service.
  • Support the delivery as required of all projects that impact HR, Finance and Payroll functions.

    • Ceridian combines the excitement of a startup environment, with the growth opportunities of a large organization. We believe our employees should be happy and healthy, with peace of mind and a sense of fulfillment. We provide our employees with comprehensive benefits for various life circumstances and needs, great opportunities for career development, and a balanced lifestyle to achieve personal and professional success.

    Ceridian is fueled by the diversity of our talented employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace all individuals and what makes them unique. We consider all applicants, regardless of age, religion, race, color, ancestry, gender, gender identity, disability, national origin, race, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. We enthusiastically encourage all individuals to apply for positions that fit their passions. Come join our inclusive team and start collaborating with us on award winning projects!

    Connect with us on Twitter @Ceridian or Facebook at Ceridian

    We thank all applicants in advance for their interest in this position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

This leading multi-national company has a number of niche operating divisions supporting a wide range of clients within the Metro and Regional areas and seeking a senior manager to support contractual delivery.

Base Criteria
Over 5 years senior-level experience in commercial management with a detailed understanding of contractual arrangements, clauses and abatements and the ability to interpret and ascertain specific references or inferences.

Ideally holding tertiary qualifications in Accounting, Finance or Quantity Surveying you will have career experience exceeding 10 years in a complex contractual environment, gained within the Facilities Management, Property, PPP or Construction sectors.

Outline Duties / Knowledge
  • Excellent Contractual Awareness overseeing colleagues to ensure they meet the obligations and criteria of the agreement.
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills to ensure the timely and consistent tracking of income, project payments and variations and communicating these effectively to board level.
  • Well-developed interpersonal and communications skills, effectively and efficiency liaising with stakeholders.
  • Problem-solver with a long-term strategic view to ensure systems, processes and policies introduced are sustainable and support ongoing delivery and whole of life plans across 3-, 5-, 10- and 20-years.

Role offers an attractive Base Salary, Super and Car Allowance.

Deal with experienced professionals, AustCorp’s FM lead recruiters have over 85 years industry experience!

For additional opportunities within Australia, Asia, Middle East or Africa please visit our web-site - www.austcorpexecutive.com.au

Industry

  • Construction
  • Architecture & Planning

Full-time

[

Engineer, Platform

Company Name Auth0 Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Auth0, a global leader in Identity-as-a-Service (IDaaS), provides thousands of enterprise customers with a Universal Identity Platform for their web, mobile, IoT, and internal applications. Its extensible platform seamlessly authenticates and secures more than 1.5B logins per month, making it loved by developers and trusted by global enterprises. Auth0 has raised more than $110 million to date and continues its global growth at a rapid pace. We are consistently recognized as a great place to work based our outstanding leadership and dedication to company culture, and are looking for the best people to join our incredible team spread across more than 35 countries!

Auth0 is looking for the right person to join its Core Platform Runtime Team. This team is focused on building the runtime and supporting services for Auth0 development teams to deploy and run their software on.

As a member of this team, you will work on services and guidance to enable rapid deployment of reliable, scalable and secure services, using Kubernetes and Docker.

This is a role with a huge impact. You will get to work with engineers throughout the organization and what you build will be relied on by Auth0 engineers for a long period of time.

You Will
    • Implement a Platform Runtime that allows development teams to deploy and run their services
    • Research and implement solutions that address cross cutting concerns such as configuration, service routing, observability, and service discovery
    • Provide guidance to engineering teams to effectively move to a docker-based platform
    • Be on-call for all services and components owned by the Platform team

You might be a good fit for this role if you:
    • Have at least 5 years of full-time programming experience
    • Are passionate about working on systems that are highly reliable, maintainable, scalable and secure
    • Enjoy learning and applying new technologies
    • Enjoy enabling other teams to move faster
    • Are a good communicator and enjoy interacting with people
    • Like to work at many levels of technology, from writing code to designing straightforward solutions to technical problems
    • Have worked with technologies like Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
    • Enjoy being part of a highly collaborative, remote first environment

You can learn more about our hiring process here .

Preferred Location:
    • GMT-10 ; GMT-9 ; GMT-8 ; GMT-7 ; GMT-6 ; GMT-5 ; GMT-4

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Auth0 participates in E-Verify and will confirm work authorization for candidates residing in the United States.

  • Full time, 3-month fixed term contract\xa0

Who we are


When you start to think of waste as a resource, it opens up a world of possibilities. Cleanaway is the largest waste management company in Australia providing sustainable waste management solutions to a range of customers including councils, small businesses, large corporate entities and government agencies to provide sustainable waste management solutions.


\xa0


The position


We have an exciting opportunity for an agile HR Coordinator to join Cleanaway’s HR Central team on a 3-month fixed term contract with the potential to go permanent! Reporting to the HR Services Manager, this role will be diverse and hands on giving you exposure to a range of HR functions. This established HR services team has a backdrop of exciting initiatives including a focus on best practice processes and service the business wide. Your role will support both corporate and operational leaders in administration elements of the recruitment lifecycle.


  • HR Administration activities
  • End to end recruitment functions including ad generation and processing on Page Up
  • Administering contacts
  • Setting up new employees in Preceda
  • Sending new employee paperwork
  • Maintain Human Resource Information System data

  • First point of contact for the business, provide assistance to and answer queries from the business

\xa0


Skills and Experience


We at Cleanaway hold ourselves and each other by our Values which define our standard of behavior. We seek people who live by these Values; Home Safe, Own It, Team before Self, Agile and Proud.


  • Tertiary Qualification, in the field of Business, Human Resources, or relevant industry experience
  • Experience within HR would be highly regarded
  • Previous experience in an office environment required

  • Ability to work autonomously and prioritise your work loads

Benefits


  • Diverse role with exposure across various areas of HR
  • Temp to perm opportunity
  • High performing business ASX 100 listed
  • Collaborative and supportive team environment
  • Exposure to both Blue and White-Collar environments

\xa0


Cleanaway is an employer of equal opportunity and encourages and values diversity and inclusion. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.
